instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Liquid Damage No Keyboard or Trackpad. Board damage?
threads.message:
Hi got this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 12" 2015 Retina MacBook in for repair after a small spill over the Keyboard. My first ever 12" Retina I've worked on. The Keyboard is completely unresponsive as well as the Trackpad. I was first tempted to replace the top case as these are absolutely notorious for their Butterfly Keyboards failing, but all Keys dead and a dead Trackpad seem to me like it could be a board level issue.... Don't have a second machine to swap the to case with for testing at the moment.

Anyone ever seen this before?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Liquid Damage No Keyboard or Trackpad. Board damage?
threads.message:
If the spill was over keyboard, tou must start changing entire KB/TP assembly.
There is a complex electronic circuitry.
You can try to clean that small board; also check the flex terminals....
